story.text: TORONTO Jan 3 The Toronto Stock Exchange's main index slid shortly after market open on Wednesday as weaker resource and energy shares pulled the broader benchmark into the red. The S&P/TSX composite index was down 24.00 points, or 0.2 percent, at 12,899.66 shortly after the year's second session kicked off, reversing the 15-point gain made on Tuesday. Six of the composite's main 10 groups advanced. But the heavyweight materials sector, which includes gold miners, and the energy sector lost 0.74 percent and 1.1 percent, respectively. The key groups' declines reflected softness in their underlying commodity prices. Oil fell toward $60.50 a barrel as warm weather in the United States ate into heating oil demand. Base metals also fell, dragged down by copper prices which touched their lowest levels since early April. Zinc giant Teck Cominco Ltd. (TCKb.TO) was among the biggest losers, giving up C$2.95, or 3.4 percent, to C$82.98. Energy giant EnCana Corp. (ECA.TO) eased 90 Canadian cents to C$53.45. ($1=$1.17 Canadian)
story.title: weaker resources , energy drag toronto stocks lower
